articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel says it is determined to destroy Iran's nuclear capabilities in its military campaign, but that it also wants to avoid any nuclear disaster in a region that is home to tens of millions of people and produces much of the world's oil.
articles.title: What are the nuclear contamination risks from Israel's attacks on Iran?

articles.author: Steve Holland, Parisa Hafezi, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Iran and Israel traded further air attacks on Thursday as President Donald Trump kept the world guessing about whether the United States would join Israel's bombardment of Iranian nuclear facilities.
articles.title: Iran, Israel trade fresh air attacks as Trump weighs US involvement

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Phil Stewart, Steve Holland, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Roughly one month ago, from the stage at an investment forum in Saudi Arabia, U.S. President Donald Trump issued a warning to Iran that would prove prophetic.
articles.title: Insight: How Trump, a self-proclaimed "peacemaker," embraced Israel's campaign against Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine and Russia exchanged prisoners of war on Thursday, officials from both countries said, the latest round of swaps under an agreement struck in Istanbul.
articles.title: Ukraine and Russia exchange POWs in latest swap

articles.author: Jaspreet Singh, Cassell Bryan-Low
articles.description: SpaceX's massive Starship spacecraft exploded into a dramatic fireball during testing in Texas, the latest in a series of setbacks for Elon Musk’s Mars rocket program.
articles.title: SpaceX Starship rocket explodes in setback to Musk's Mars mission

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jeff Mason
articles.description: The prospect of a U.S. strike against Iran has exposed divisions in the coalition of supporters that brought President Donald Trump to power, with some of his base urging him not to get the country involved in a new Middle East war.
articles.title: Trump faces uproar from MAGA base over possible Iran strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Thursday appointed Hennadiy Shapovalov commander of Ukraine's land forces, replacing a commander who resigned over a Russian strike on a training area.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy appoints new commander of land forces

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ebrahim Hajjaj
articles.description: Like thousands of other Palestinians in Gaza, Hind Al-Nawajha takes a dangerous, miles-long journey every day to try to get some food for her family, hoping she makes it back alive.
articles.title: As death toll rises, Gazans make life-risking journeys to seek food

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Kenyan court on Thursday sentenced two men to 30 years in prison for aiding a 2019 attack by militant members of the al Shabaab group on a hotel and office complex in Nairobi that killed 21 people.
articles.title: Kenyan court sentences two men to 30 years in prison for aiding 2019 hotel attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syria this week carried out its first international bank transfer via the SWIFT international payment system since the outbreak of the country’s 14-year civil war, central bank governor Abdelkader Husriyeh said on Thursday, a milestone in Syria’s push to reintegrate into the global financial system.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syria made first direct international bank transfer via SWIFT since war, central bank governor says
